job title: Scientist I/II/III, Drug Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics
job description:
Description:

Boehringer Ingelheim is seeking a
highly motivated Scientist I/II/III to join the Drug Metabolism &
Pharmacokinetics (DMPK) department at our US headquarters in Ridgefield, CT.

As a Scientist I/II/III, you will be
responsible for conducting metabolite identification and structural elucidation
experiments in support of our small molecule development candidates. You will
be expected to evaluate and interpret experimental data and contribute toward
the advancement of the field of drug metabolism. Studies involving the use of radioactive
tracers will be routinely employed. Active
and productive collaboration with other scientists in the fields of drug
metabolism, transporters, and pharmacokinetics will also be expected.

As an employee of
Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery,
development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our
global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate
internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to
the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage
lie with our people. We support our employees in a number of ways to foster a
healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion,
mobility, networking and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and
benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees

Duties &
Responsibilities:
  • Efficiently conduct, interpret, and report metabolite
    identification data from in vitro, preclinical, and clinical studies utilizing
    high resolution accurate mass spectrometry.
  • Participate in the development and
    implementation of new technologies in the field of metabolite identification
    and biotransformation.
  • Comply with applicable regulations, perform
    all work in a safe and responsible manner, and maintain proper records in
    accordance with SOPs and corporate policies.
  • Effectively and
    clearly communicate results in written reports and oral presentations.
  • Comply with
    applicable regulations, perform all work in a safe and responsible manner, and
    maintain proper records in accordance with SOPs and corporate policies.
  • Initiate and
    complete routine procedures in an independent and efficient manner, with
    minimal supervision; independently operate LC/MS systems; troubleshoot
    effectively.
  • Demonstrate
    technical ability to assist in the design and execution of non-routine
    experiments.Initiates and completes routine procedures in an independent and efficient
    manner; Troubleshoots effectively and solves scientific problems independently;
    Operates lab equipment and is independently responsible for maintenance
  • Designs
    and executes non-routine experiments on a basis of literature analyses with
    minimal supervision
  • Independently applies basic scientific principles, performs literature
    searches, attends scientific meetings, and keeps abreast of literature in own
    field
Scientist I Requirements:
  • Bachelor's of Science degree in in Chemistry “Organic and/or Analytical”, Biochemistry, Pharmacy, Biology, or other relevant field 0 years experience in related field
  • Laboratory experience should include familiarity with LC-MS, LC-MS/MS, HRMS, and NMR instrumentation preferred
  • Experience with mass spectrometry software (Analyst, MassLynx, and/or Xcalibur) would be advantageous.
  • Familiarity with general principles of small molecule biotransformation is considered beneficial.
  • Experience with the safe and appropriate use of radioactivity is preferred.
  • Effective oral and written communication skills are essential.

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry “Organic and/or Analytical”, Biochemistry, Pharmacy, Biology, or other relevant field from an
    accredited institution with three-plus (3 ) years of experience in related

  • Laboratory experience should include familiarity with LC-MS, LC-MS/MS, HRMS, and NMR instrumentation preferred
  • Experience with mass spectrometry software (Analyst, MassLynx, and/or Xcalibur) would be advantageous.
  • Familiarity with general principles of small molecule biotransformation is considered beneficial.
  • Experience with the safe and appropriate use of radioactivity is preferred.
  • Effective oral and written communication skills are essential.
Scientist III Requirements:
  • Master’s Degree from
    an accredited institution Chemistry “Organic and/or Analytical”, Biochemistry, Pharmacy, Biology, or other relevant field with three-plus (3 ) years of experience in related
    scientific discipline, OR Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution Chemistry “Organic and/or Analytical”, Biochemistry, Pharmacy, Biology, or other relevant field with
    seven-plus (7 ) years of experience in related scientific discipline or

  • Laboratory experience should include familiarity with LC-MS,
    LC-MS/MS, HRMS, and NMR instrumentation preferred
  • Experience with mass spectrometry software (Analyst, MassLynx,
    and/or Xcalibur) would be advantageous.
  • Familiarity with general principles
    of small molecule biotransformation is considered beneficial.
  • Experience with the safe and appropriate use of radioactivity

  • Effective oral and written communication skills are

Eligibility
Requirements:

  • Must be 18 years of
